item.description:
We're hosting the Connecticut Drinking Skeptically meetup group's webcast of the 2009 Ig® Nobel Prizes at the library at USNH.

You can get more information about the meetup at http://skeptics.meetu..., and more about the Ig® Nobel Prizes at http://improbable.com....

This is the same webcast you can watch on your computer at home. It should be more fun watching it with a bunch of other people.

"The Ig Nobel Prizes honor achievements that first make people laugh, and then make them think. The prizes are intended to celebrate the unusual, honor the imaginative -- and spur people's interest in science, medicine, and technology.

In a gala ceremony in Harvard's Sanders Theatre, 1200 splendidly eccentric spectators watch the winners step forward to accept their Prizes. These are physically handed out by genuinely bemused genuine Nobel Laureates."

The ceremony starts at 7:00 PM, so you may want to turn up a few minutes early.

We may also order pizza, consumption of which is optional.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be upstairs in the library.
item.name: The Ig® Nobel Prizes webcast
